title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 26, 2022
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 26, 2022 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome for Beginners
items.content_text:
### TypeScript * [Hasura GraphQL Engine (‚≠ê32k)](https://github.com/hasura/graphql-engine) *(label: good first issue)*
Blazing fast, instant realtime GraphQL APIs on Postgres with fine grained access control, also trigger webhooks on database events. * [OpenMetadata (‚≠ê7.1k)](https://github.com/open-metadata/OpenMetadata) *(label: good first issue)*
OpenMetadata is an all-in-one platform for data discovery, data quality, observability, governance, data lineage, and team collaboration. * [H2O Wave (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/h2oai/wave) *(label: good first issue)*
Realtime Web Apps and Dashboards framework for Python and R. Suited (not only) for AI audience.
items.content_html:
TypeScript

  • Hasura GraphQL Engine (‚≠ê32k) (label: good first issue)
    Blazing fast, instant realtime GraphQL APIs on Postgres with fine grained access control, also trigger webhooks on database events.
  • OpenMetadata (‚≠ê7.1k) (label: good first issue)
    OpenMetadata is an all-in-one platform for data discovery, data quality, observability, governance, data lineage, and team collaboration.
  • H2O Wave (‚≠ê4.1k) (label: good first issue)
    Realtime Web Apps and Dashboards framework for Python and R. Suited (not only) for AI audience.

items.title: Awesome Prisma
items.content_text:
### :trophy: Tutorials / :gear: Schema Visualization Tools

*   [Build A Pet Management System With Remix, Prisma, and Postgres](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wqyHGQlZcws\&list=PLTnRtjQN5ieYu9SdwLvzKYFVtfqySY7FT)

### :space_invader: Projects Using Prisma / Tutorials with [NestJS](https://nestjs.com/)

*   [Neighborhood Pet Manager (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/AustinGil/npm)
items.content_html:
üèÜ Tutorials / ‚öôÔ∏è Schema Visualization Tools

  • Build A Pet Management System With Remix, Prisma, and Postgres

üëæ Projects Using Prisma / Tutorials with NestJS

  • Neighborhood Pet Manager (‚≠ê7)

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### (requires Neovim 0.5) / Diagnostics

*   [onsails/diaglist.nvim (‚≠ê193)](https://github.com/onsails/diaglist.nvim) - Live render workspace diagnostics in quickfix, buffer diagnostics in loclist.
*   [folke/trouble.nvim (‚≠ê6.3k)](https://github.com/folke/trouble.nvim) - A pretty diagnostics list to help you solve all the trouble your code is causing.

### YAML / Diagnostics

*   [someone-stole-my-name/yaml-companion.nvim (‚≠ê261)](https://github.com/someone-stole-my-name/yaml-companion.nvim) - Get, set and autodetect YAML schemas in your buffers.
*   [cuducos/yaml.nvim (‚≠ê223)](https://github.com/cuducos/yaml.nvim) - Utils to work with YAML files.

### Language / Diagnostics

*   [potamides/pantran.nvim (‚≠ê320)](https://github.com/potamides/pantran.nvim) - Translate your text with an interactive translation window.

### Search / Diagnostics

*   [kevinhwang91/nvim-hlslens (‚≠ê843)](https://github.com/kevinhwang91/nvim-hlslens) - Helps you better glance searched information, seamlessly jump matched instances.
*   [rktjmp/highlight-current-n.nvim (‚≠ê92)](https://github.com/rktjmp/highlight-current-n.nvim) - Highlights the current /, ? or \* match under your cursor when pressing n or N and gets out of the way afterwards.
*   [gaborvecsei/memento.nvim (‚≠ê63)](https://github.com/gaborvecsei/memento.nvim) - Keeps track of your visited file history after a buffer is closed. Reopen files more easily.

### File Explorer / Diagnostics

*   [luukvbaal/nnn.nvim (‚≠ê447)](https://github.com/luukvbaal/nnn.nvim) - File explorer powered by [nnn (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/jarun/nnn) and Lua.
*   [tamago324/lir.nvim (‚≠ê369)](https://github.com/tamago324/lir.nvim) - Simple file explorer.
*   [Xuyuanp/yanil (‚≠ê97)](https://github.com/Xuyuanp/yanil) - Yet Another Nerdtree In Lua.
*   [nvim-neo-tree/neo-tree.nvim (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/nvim-neo-tree/neo-tree.nvim) - Neo-tree is a Neovim plugin to browse the file system and other tree like structures in whatever style suits you, including sidebars, floating windows, netrw split style, or all of them at once.
*   [theblob42/drex.nvim (‚≠ê95)](https://github.com/TheBlob42/drex.nvim) - A simple and configurable file explorer written in Lua.

### Project / Diagnostics

*   [windwp/nvim-projectconfig (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/windwp/nvim-projectconfig) - Load Neovim config depend on project directory.
*   [ahmedkhalf/project.nvim (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/ahmedkhalf/project.nvim) - An all in one Neovim plugin that provides superior project management.
*   [klen/nvim-config-local (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/klen/nvim-config-local) - Secure load local config files from working directories.

### Colorscheme Creation / Diagnostics

*   [rktjmp/lush.nvim (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/rktjmp/lush.nvim) - Define Neovim themes as a DSL in Lua, with real-time feedback.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.base16 (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-base16.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` with fast implementation of base16 theme for manually supplied palette.

### Statusline / Diagnostics

*   [tjdevries/express\_line.nvim (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/tjdevries/express_line.nvim) - Supports co-routines, functions and jobs.
*   [nvim-lualine/lualine.nvim (‚≠ê7.2k)](https://github.com/nvim-lualine/lualine.nvim) - A blazing fast and easy to configure Neovim statusline.
*   [ojroques/nvim-hardline (‚≠ê188)](https://github.com/ojroques/nvim-hardline) - A statusline / bufferline. It is inspired by [vim-airline (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/vim-airline/vim-airline) but aims to be as light and simple as possible.
*   [konapun/vacuumline.nvim (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/konapun/vacuumline.nvim) - A galaxyline configuration inspired by airline.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.statusline (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-statusline.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for minimal and fast statusline. Supports content change depending on window width.
*   [b0o/incline.nvim (‚≠ê912)](https://github.com/b0o/incline.nvim) - Lightweight floating statuslines, intended for use with Neovim's new global statusline.
*   [rebelot/heirline.nvim (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/rebelot/heirline.nvim) - Heirline.nvim is a no-nonsense Neovim Statusline plugin designed around recursive inheritance to be exceptionally fast and versatile.
*   [yaocccc/nvim-lines.lua (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/yaocccc/nvim-lines.lua) - A fast, light, customizable Neovim statusline and tabline(buffers) plugin.

### Tabline / Diagnostics

*   [romgrk/barbar.nvim (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/romgrk/barbar.nvim) - The Neovim tabline plugin.
*   [crispgm/nvim-tabline (‚≠ê84)](https://github.com/crispgm/nvim-tabline) - Neovim port of tabline.vim with Lua.
*   [alvarosevilla95/luatab.nvim (‚≠ê197)](https://github.com/alvarosevilla95/luatab.nvim) - A simple tabline written in Lua.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.tabline (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-tabline.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for minimal tabline showing listed buffers in case of one tab and falling back to default otherwise.
*   [rafcamlet/tabline-framework.nvim (‚≠ê98)](https://github.com/rafcamlet/tabline-framework.nvim) - User-friendly framework for building your dream tabline in a few lines of code.
*   [nanozuki/tabby.nvim (‚≠ê682)](https://github.com/nanozuki/tabby.nvim) - A minimal, configurable, Neovim style tabline. Use your Neovim tabs as workspace multiplexer.

### Cursorline / Diagnostics

*   [xiyaowong/nvim-cursorword (‚≠ê145)](https://github.com/xiyaowong/nvim-cursorword) - Part of nvim-cursorline. Highlight the word under the cursor.
*   [RRethy/vim-illuminate (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/RRethy/vim-illuminate) - Highlight the word under the cursor. Neovim's builtin LSP is available, it can be used to highlight more intelligently.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.cursorword (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-cursorword.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for automatic highlighting of word under cursor (displayed after customizable delay).

### Startup / Diagnostics

*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.starter (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-starter.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for start screen. Displayed items are fully customizable, item selection can be done using prefix query with instant visual feedback.
*   [henriquehbr/nvim-startup.lua](https://sr.ht/~henriquehbr/nvim-startup.lua) - Displays Neovim startup time.

### Media / Diagnostics

*   [ekickx/clipboard-image.nvim (‚≠ê328)](https://github.com/ekickx/clipboard-image.nvim) - Neovim Lua plugin to paste image from clipboard.
*   [askfiy/nvim-picgo (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/askfiy/nvim-picgo) - A picgo-core-based Neovim plugin, written in Lua, that allows you to upload images to the image bed, which means you can view your images from anywhere on the internet.
*   [madskjeldgaard/reaper-nvim (‚≠ê70)](https://github.com/madskjeldgaard/reaper-nvim) - Remote control Reaper DAW from Neovim.
*   [davidgranstrom/scnvim (‚≠ê244)](https://github.com/davidgranstrom/scnvim) - Neovim frontend for SuperCollider.
*   [krady21/compiler-explorer.nvim (‚≠ê159)](https://github.com/krady21/compiler-explorer.nvim) - Async Lua plugin for interacting with [compiler-explorer](https://godbolt.org/).

### Note Taking / Diagnostics

*   [jakewvincent/mkdnflow.nvim (‚≠ê750)](https://github.com/jakewvincent/mkdnflow.nvim) - Fluent markdown notebook navigation & management (create links, follow links, create and manage to-do lists, reference bib files, and more).

### Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

*   [LoricAndre/OneTerm.nvim (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/LoricAndre/OneTerm.nvim) - Plugin framework for running commands in the terminal.
*   [nikvdp/neomux (‚≠ê365)](https://github.com/nikvdp/neomux) - Control Neovim from shells running inside Neovim.
*   [numToStr/FTerm.nvim (‚≠ê781)](https://github.com/numToStr/FTerm.nvim) - No nonsense floating terminal written in Lua.
*   [jghauser/kitty-runner.nvim (‚≠ê103)](https://github.com/jghauser/kitty-runner.nvim) - Poor man's REPL. Easily send buffer lines and commands to a kitty terminal.
*   [s1n7ax/nvim-terminal (‚≠ê118)](https://github.com/s1n7ax/nvim-terminal) - A simple & easy to use multi-terminal plugin.
*   [m00qek/baleia.nvim (‚≠ê163)](https://github.com/m00qek/baleia.nvim) - Colorize text with ANSI escape sequences (8, 16, 256 or TrueColor).

### Quickfix / Diagnostics

*   [kevinhwang91/nvim-bqf (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/kevinhwang91/nvim-bqf) - The goal of nvim-bqf is to make Neovim's quickfix window better.

### Test / Diagnostics

*   [klen/nvim-test (‚≠ê190)](https://github.com/klen/nvim-test) - A Neovim wrapper for running tests.
*   [nvim-neotest/neotest (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/nvim-neotest/neotest) - An extensible framework for interacting with tests within Neovim.
*   [andythigpen/nvim-coverage (‚≠ê381)](https://github.com/andythigpen/nvim-coverage) - Displays coverage information in the sign column.

### Code Runner / Diagnostics

*   [michaelb/sniprun (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/michaelb/sniprun) - Run parts of code of any language directly from Neovim.
*   [CRAG666/code\_runner.nvim (‚≠ê620)](https://github.com/CRAG666/code_runner.nvim) - The best code runner you could have, with super powers.
*   [jedrzejboczar/toggletasks.nvim (‚≠ê158)](https://github.com/jedrzejboczar/toggletasks.nvim) - Task runner with JSON/YAML configs, using toggleterm.nvim and telescope.nvim.
*   [EthanJWright/vs-tasks.nvim (‚≠ê200)](https://github.com/EthanJWright/vs-tasks.nvim) - Telescope picker for VSCode style tasks.
*   [stevearc/overseer.nvim (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/stevearc/overseer.nvim) - A task runner and job management plugin.

### GitHub / Diagnostics

*   [pwntester/octo.nvim (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/pwntester/octo.nvim) - Work with GitHub issues and PRs from Neovim. Just edit the issue description.
*   [pwntester/codeql.nvim (‚≠ê106)](https://github.com/pwntester/codeql.nvim) - Neovim plugin to help writing and testing CodeQL queries.

### Keybinding / Diagnostics

*   [folke/which-key.nvim (‚≠ê6.3k)](https://github.com/folke/which-key.nvim) - Neovim plugin that shows a popup with possible keybindings of the command you started typing.
*   [Iron-E/nvim-cartographer (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/Iron-E/nvim-cartographer) - a more convenient `:map`ping syntax for Lua environments.
*   [LionC/nest.nvim (‚≠ê234)](https://github.com/LionC/nest.nvim) - Lua utility to map keys concisely using cascading trees. Also allows binding Lua functions to keys.
*   [anuvyklack/keymap-amend.nvim (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/anuvyklack/keymap-amend.nvim) - Amend the existing keymap.
*   [max397574/better-escape.nvim (‚≠ê735)](https://github.com/max397574/better-escape.nvim) - Create shortcuts to escape insert mode without getting delay.

### Scrollbar / Diagnostics

*   [petertriho/nvim-scrollbar (‚≠ê958)](https://github.com/petertriho/nvim-scrollbar) - Extensible scrollbar that shows diagnostics and search results.

### Comment / Diagnostics

*   [b3nj5m1n/kommentary (‚≠ê534)](https://github.com/b3nj5m1n/kommentary) - Commenting plugin written in Lua.
*   [gennaro-tedesco/nvim-commaround (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/gennaro-tedesco/nvim-commaround) - Fast and light commenting plugin written in Lua.
*   [folke/todo-comments.nvim (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/folke/todo-comments.nvim) - Highlight, list and search todo comments in your projects.
*   [winston0410/commented.nvim (‚≠ê113)](https://github.com/winston0410/commented.nvim) - A commenting plugin that supports counts and multiple comment patterns and much more.
*   [s1n7ax/nvim-comment-frame (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/s1n7ax/nvim-comment-frame) - Adds a comment frame based on the source file.
*   [danymat/neogen (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/danymat/neogen) - A better annotation generator. Supports multiple languages and annotation conventions.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.comment (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-comment.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for per-line commenting. Fully supports dot-repeat.
*   [LudoPinelli/comment-box.nvim (‚≠ê452)](https://github.com/LudoPinelli/comment-box.nvim) - Clarify and beautify your comments using boxes and lines.

### Indent / Diagnostics

*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.indentscope (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-indentscope.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for visualizing and operating on indent scope. Supports customization of debounce delay, animation style, and different granularity of options for scope computing algorithm.

### Remote Development / Diagnostics

*   [chipsenkbeil/distant.nvim (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/chipsenkbeil/distant.nvim) - Edit files, run programs, and work with LSP on a remote machine from the comfort of your local environment.
*   [jamestthompson3/nvim-remote-containers (‚≠ê921)](https://github.com/jamestthompson3/nvim-remote-containers) - Develop inside docker containers, just like VSCode.
*   [esensar/nvim-dev-container (‚≠ê638)](https://github.com/esensar/nvim-dev-container) - Neovim devcontainer.json and general development container support.

### Split and Window / Diagnostics

*   [\~henriquehbr/ataraxis.lua](https://sr.ht/~henriquehbr/ataraxis.lua) - A zen mode for improving code readability on Neovim.
*   [sindrets/winshift.nvim (‚≠ê517)](https://github.com/sindrets/winshift.nvim) - Rearrange your windows with ease.
*   [anuvyklack/windows.nvim (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/anuvyklack/windows.nvim) - Automatically expand width of the current window. Maximizes and restore it. And all this with nice animations!
*   [famiu/bufdelete.nvim (‚≠ê523)](https://github.com/famiu/bufdelete.nvim) - Delete Neovim buffers without losing your window layout.
*   [echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.bufremove (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.nvim/blob/main/readmes/mini-bufremove.md) - Module of `mini.nvim` for buffer removing (unshow, delete, wipeout) while saving window layout.

### Tmux / Diagnostics

*   [danielpieper/telescope-tmuxinator.nvim (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/danielpieper/telescope-tmuxinator.nvim) - Integration for tmuxinator with telescope.nvim.
*   [hkupty/nvimux (‚≠ê447)](https://github.com/hkupty/nvimux) - Neovim as tmux replacement.
*   [numToStr/Navigator.nvim (‚≠ê424)](https://github.com/numToStr/Navigator.nvim) - Smoothly navigate between Neovim splits and Tmux panes.
*   [declancm/windex.nvim (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/declancm/windex.nvim) - Collection of window functions which includes moving between, closing and maximizing Neovim splits and Tmux panes.

### Game / Diagnostics

*   [ThePrimeagen/vim-be-good (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/ThePrimeagen/vim-be-good) - Vim-be-good is a Neovim plugin designed to make you better at Vim Movements.
*   [alec-gibson/nvim-tetris (‚≠ê203)](https://github.com/alec-gibson/nvim-tetris) - Bringing emacs' greatest feature to Neovim - Tetris!.
*   [seandewar/nvimesweeper (‚≠ê103)](https://github.com/seandewar/nvimesweeper) - Play Minesweeper in your favourite text editor.
*   [seandewar/killersheep.nvim (‚≠ê71)](https://github.com/seandewar/killersheep.nvim) - Neovim port of killersheep.

### Boilerplate / Diagnostics

*   [m00qek/plugin-template.nvim (‚≠ê130)](https://github.com/m00qek/plugin-template.nvim) - A plugin template that setups test infrastructure and GitHub Actions.
items.content_html:
(requires Neovim 0.5) / Diagnostics

  • onsails/diaglist.nvim (‚≠ê193) - Live render workspace diagnostics in quickfix, buffer diagnostics in loclist.
  • folke/trouble.nvim (‚≠ê6.3k) - A pretty diagnostics list to help you solve all the trouble your code is causing.

YAML / Diagnostics

  • someone-stole-my-name/yaml-companion.nvim (‚≠ê261) - Get, set and autodetect YAML schemas in your buffers.
  • cuducos/yaml.nvim (‚≠ê223) - Utils to work with YAML files.

Language / Diagnostics

  • potamides/pantran.nvim (‚≠ê320) - Translate your text with an interactive translation window.

Search / Diagnostics

  • kevinhwang91/nvim-hlslens (‚≠ê843) - Helps you better glance searched information, seamlessly jump matched instances.
  • rktjmp/highlight-current-n.nvim (‚≠ê92) - Highlights the current /, ? or * match under your cursor when pressing n or N and gets out of the way afterwards.
  • gaborvecsei/memento.nvim (‚≠ê63) - Keeps track of your visited file history after a buffer is closed. Reopen files more easily.

File Explorer / Diagnostics

  • luukvbaal/nnn.nvim (‚≠ê447) - File explorer powered by nnn (‚≠ê20k) and Lua.
  • tamago324/lir.nvim (‚≠ê369) - Simple file explorer.
  • Xuyuanp/yanil (‚≠ê97) - Yet Another Nerdtree In Lua.
  • nvim-neo-tree/neo-tree.nvim (‚≠ê4.7k) - Neo-tree is a Neovim plugin to browse the file system and other tree like structures in whatever style suits you, including sidebars, floating windows, netrw split style, or all of them at once.
  • theblob42/drex.nvim (‚≠ê95) - A simple and configurable file explorer written in Lua.

Project / Diagnostics

  • windwp/nvim-projectconfig (‚≠ê109) - Load Neovim config depend on project directory.
  • ahmedkhalf/project.nvim (‚≠ê1.5k) - An all in one Neovim plugin that provides superior project management.
  • klen/nvim-config-local (‚≠ê165) - Secure load local config files from working directories.

Colorscheme Creation / Diagnostics

  • rktjmp/lush.nvim (‚≠ê1.6k) - Define Neovim themes as a DSL in Lua, with real-time feedback.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.base16 (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim with fast implementation of base16 theme for manually supplied palette.

Statusline / Diagnostics

  • tjdevries/express_line.nvim (‚≠ê307) - Supports co-routines, functions and jobs.
  • nvim-lualine/lualine.nvim (‚≠ê7.2k) - A blazing fast and easy to configure Neovim statusline.
  • ojroques/nvim-hardline (‚≠ê188) - A statusline / bufferline. It is inspired by vim-airline (‚≠ê18k) but aims to be as light and simple as possible.
  • konapun/vacuumline.nvim (‚≠ê29) - A galaxyline configuration inspired by airline.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.statusline (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for minimal and fast statusline. Supports content change depending on window width.
  • b0o/incline.nvim (‚≠ê912) - Lightweight floating statuslines, intended for use with Neovim's new global statusline.
  • rebelot/heirline.nvim (‚≠ê1.2k) - Heirline.nvim is a no-nonsense Neovim Statusline plugin designed around recursive inheritance to be exceptionally fast and versatile.
  • yaocccc/nvim-lines.lua (‚≠ê36) - A fast, light, customizable Neovim statusline and tabline(buffers) plugin.

Tabline / Diagnostics

  • romgrk/barbar.nvim (‚≠ê2.5k) - The Neovim tabline plugin.
  • crispgm/nvim-tabline (‚≠ê84) - Neovim port of tabline.vim with Lua.
  • alvarosevilla95/luatab.nvim (‚≠ê197) - A simple tabline written in Lua.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.tabline (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for minimal tabline showing listed buffers in case of one tab and falling back to default otherwise.
  • rafcamlet/tabline-framework.nvim (‚≠ê98) - User-friendly framework for building your dream tabline in a few lines of code.
  • nanozuki/tabby.nvim (‚≠ê682) - A minimal, configurable, Neovim style tabline. Use your Neovim tabs as workspace multiplexer.

Cursorline / Diagnostics

  • xiyaowong/nvim-cursorword (‚≠ê145) - Part of nvim-cursorline. Highlight the word under the cursor.
  • RRethy/vim-illuminate (‚≠ê2.4k) - Highlight the word under the cursor. Neovim's builtin LSP is available, it can be used to highlight more intelligently.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.cursorword (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for automatic highlighting of word under cursor (displayed after customizable delay).

Startup / Diagnostics

  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.starter (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for start screen. Displayed items are fully customizable, item selection can be done using prefix query with instant visual feedback.
  • henriquehbr/nvim-startup.lua - Displays Neovim startup time.

Media / Diagnostics

  • ekickx/clipboard-image.nvim (‚≠ê328) - Neovim Lua plugin to paste image from clipboard.
  • askfiy/nvim-picgo (‚≠ê60) - A picgo-core-based Neovim plugin, written in Lua, that allows you to upload images to the image bed, which means you can view your images from anywhere on the internet.
  • madskjeldgaard/reaper-nvim (‚≠ê70) - Remote control Reaper DAW from Neovim.
  • davidgranstrom/scnvim (‚≠ê244) - Neovim frontend for SuperCollider.
  • krady21/compiler-explorer.nvim (‚≠ê159) - Async Lua plugin for interacting with compiler-explorer.

Note Taking / Diagnostics

  • jakewvincent/mkdnflow.nvim (‚≠ê750) - Fluent markdown notebook navigation & management (create links, follow links, create and manage to-do lists, reference bib files, and more).

Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

  • LoricAndre/OneTerm.nvim (‚≠ê57) - Plugin framework for running commands in the terminal.
  • nikvdp/neomux (‚≠ê365) - Control Neovim from shells running inside Neovim.
  • numToStr/FTerm.nvim (‚≠ê781) - No nonsense floating terminal written in Lua.
  • jghauser/kitty-runner.nvim (‚≠ê103) - Poor man's REPL. Easily send buffer lines and commands to a kitty terminal.
  • s1n7ax/nvim-terminal (‚≠ê118) - A simple & easy to use multi-terminal plugin.
  • m00qek/baleia.nvim (‚≠ê163) - Colorize text with ANSI escape sequences (8, 16, 256 or TrueColor).

Quickfix / Diagnostics

  • kevinhwang91/nvim-bqf (‚≠ê1.9k) - The goal of nvim-bqf is to make Neovim's quickfix window better.

Test / Diagnostics

  • klen/nvim-test (‚≠ê190) - A Neovim wrapper for running tests.
  • nvim-neotest/neotest (‚≠ê2.8k) - An extensible framework for interacting with tests within Neovim.
  • andythigpen/nvim-coverage (‚≠ê381) - Displays coverage information in the sign column.

Code Runner / Diagnostics

  • michaelb/sniprun (‚≠ê1.6k) - Run parts of code of any language directly from Neovim.
  • CRAG666/code_runner.nvim (‚≠ê620) - The best code runner you could have, with super powers.
  • jedrzejboczar/toggletasks.nvim (‚≠ê158) - Task runner with JSON/YAML configs, using toggleterm.nvim and telescope.nvim.
  • EthanJWright/vs-tasks.nvim (‚≠ê200) - Telescope picker for VSCode style tasks.
  • stevearc/overseer.nvim (‚≠ê1.6k) - A task runner and job management plugin.

GitHub / Diagnostics

  • pwntester/octo.nvim (‚≠ê2.8k) - Work with GitHub issues and PRs from Neovim. Just edit the issue description.
  • pwntester/codeql.nvim (‚≠ê106) - Neovim plugin to help writing and testing CodeQL queries.

Keybinding / Diagnostics

  • folke/which-key.nvim (‚≠ê6.3k) - Neovim plugin that shows a popup with possible keybindings of the command you started typing.
  • Iron-E/nvim-cartographer (‚≠ê55) - a more convenient :mapping syntax for Lua environments.
  • LionC/nest.nvim (‚≠ê234) - Lua utility to map keys concisely using cascading trees. Also allows binding Lua functions to keys.
  • anuvyklack/keymap-amend.nvim (‚≠ê67) - Amend the existing keymap.
  • max397574/better-escape.nvim (‚≠ê735) - Create shortcuts to escape insert mode without getting delay.

Scrollbar / Diagnostics

  • petertriho/nvim-scrollbar (‚≠ê958) - Extensible scrollbar that shows diagnostics and search results.

Comment / Diagnostics

  • b3nj5m1n/kommentary (‚≠ê534) - Commenting plugin written in Lua.
  • gennaro-tedesco/nvim-commaround (‚≠ê40) - Fast and light commenting plugin written in Lua.
  • folke/todo-comments.nvim (‚≠ê3.7k) - Highlight, list and search todo comments in your projects.
  • winston0410/commented.nvim (‚≠ê113) - A commenting plugin that supports counts and multiple comment patterns and much more.
  • s1n7ax/nvim-comment-frame (‚≠ê100) - Adds a comment frame based on the source file.
  • danymat/neogen (‚≠ê1.5k) - A better annotation generator. Supports multiple languages and annotation conventions.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.comment (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for per-line commenting. Fully supports dot-repeat.
  • LudoPinelli/comment-box.nvim (‚≠ê452) - Clarify and beautify your comments using boxes and lines.

Indent / Diagnostics

  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.indentscope (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for visualizing and operating on indent scope. Supports customization of debounce delay, animation style, and different granularity of options for scope computing algorithm.

Remote Development / Diagnostics

  • chipsenkbeil/distant.nvim (‚≠ê1.3k) - Edit files, run programs, and work with LSP on a remote machine from the comfort of your local environment.
  • jamestthompson3/nvim-remote-containers (‚≠ê921) - Develop inside docker containers, just like VSCode.
  • esensar/nvim-dev-container (‚≠ê638) - Neovim devcontainer.json and general development container support.

Split and Window / Diagnostics

  • ~henriquehbr/ataraxis.lua - A zen mode for improving code readability on Neovim.
  • sindrets/winshift.nvim (‚≠ê517) - Rearrange your windows with ease.
  • anuvyklack/windows.nvim (‚≠ê601) - Automatically expand width of the current window. Maximizes and restore it. And all this with nice animations!
  • famiu/bufdelete.nvim (‚≠ê523) - Delete Neovim buffers without losing your window layout.
  • echasnovski/mini.nvim#mini.bufremove (‚≠ê7.5k) - Module of mini.nvim for buffer removing (unshow, delete, wipeout) while saving window layout.

Tmux / Diagnostics

  • danielpieper/telescope-tmuxinator.nvim (‚≠ê24) - Integration for tmuxinator with telescope.nvim.
  • hkupty/nvimux (‚≠ê447) - Neovim as tmux replacement.
  • numToStr/Navigator.nvim (‚≠ê424) - Smoothly navigate between Neovim splits and Tmux panes.
  • declancm/windex.nvim (‚≠ê61) - Collection of window functions which includes moving between, closing and maximizing Neovim splits and Tmux panes.

Game / Diagnostics

  • ThePrimeagen/vim-be-good (‚≠ê3.9k) - Vim-be-good is a Neovim plugin designed to make you better at Vim Movements.
  • alec-gibson/nvim-tetris (‚≠ê203) - Bringing emacs' greatest feature to Neovim - Tetris!.
  • seandewar/nvimesweeper (‚≠ê103) - Play Minesweeper in your favourite text editor.
  • seandewar/killersheep.nvim (‚≠ê71) - Neovim port of killersheep.

Boilerplate / Diagnostics

  • m00qek/plugin-template.nvim (‚≠ê130) - A plugin template that setups test infrastructure and GitHub Actions.

items.title: Awesome Digital History
items.content_text:
### Archives and primary sources / Global

*   [United Nations Archive](https://archives.un.org/) - Archives and records from the United Nations regarding Secretaries-Generals, departments and missions.

### Archives and primary sources / North America

*   [National Archives](https://www.archives.gov/) - The official archives regarding veteran records, founding documents and presidential libraries of the United States.
items.content_html:
Archives and primary sources / Global

  • United Nations Archive - Archives and records from the United Nations regarding Secretaries-Generals, departments and missions.

Archives and primary sources / North America

  • National Archives - The official archives regarding veteran records, founding documents and presidential libraries of the United States.

items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Articles / Others

*   [WebAssembly Steals the ASP.NET Core Show in .NET 7 RC1](https://visualstudiomagazine.com/articles/2022/09/20/aspnet-core-updates.aspx) - September 20, 2022 - WebAssembly, the open source tech that makes client-side Blazor work, was the star of the ASP.NET Core show in the new [ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 7 Release Candidate 1](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/asp-net-core-updates-in-dotnet-7-rc-1/).
items.content_html:
Articles / Others

  • WebAssembly Steals the ASP.NET Core Show in .NET 7 RC1 - September 20, 2022 - WebAssembly, the open source tech that makes client-side Blazor work, was the star of the ASP.NET Core show in the new ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 7 Release Candidate 1.

items.title: Awesome Nix
items.content_text:
### Development / Discovery

*   [flake-utils-plus (‚≠ê518)](https://github.com/gytis-ivaskevicius/flake-utils-plus) - A lightweight Nix library flake for painless NixOS flake configuration.

### NixOS Configuration Editors / Desktop apps

*   [NixOS Configuration Editor (‚≠ê571)](https://github.com/vlinkz/nixos-conf-editor) - Graphical editor for NixOS configuration. Desktop app in Rust and GTK.
*   [Nix Software Center (‚≠ê704)](https://github.com/vlinkz/nix-software-center) - Install and manage Nix packages. Desktop app in Rust and GTK.

### NixOS Configuration Editors / Webinterface

*   [MyNixOS](https://mynixos.com/) - Graphical editor for Nix flakes. Create and manage configurations and modules for NixOS and Nix home-manager. Rather a Nix generator than a Nix editor, because it does not allow to import Nix files.
items.content_html:
Development / Discovery

  • flake-utils-plus (‚≠ê518) - A lightweight Nix library flake for painless NixOS flake configuration.

NixOS Configuration Editors / Desktop apps

  • NixOS Configuration Editor (‚≠ê571) - Graphical editor for NixOS configuration. Desktop app in Rust and GTK.
  • Nix Software Center (‚≠ê704) - Install and manage Nix packages. Desktop app in Rust and GTK.

NixOS Configuration Editors / Webinterface

  • MyNixOS - Graphical editor for Nix flakes. Create and manage configurations and modules for NixOS and Nix home-manager. Rather a Nix generator than a Nix editor, because it does not allow to import Nix files.

items.title: Awesome Svelte
items.content_text:
### Routers / Form Components

*   [@shaun/svelterouter (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/shaunlee/svelterouter) - Another vue-router inspired Svelte router.
items.content_html:
Routers / Form Components

  • @shaun/svelterouter (‚≠ê3) - Another vue-router inspired Svelte router.
